Name: Snivy
Description: Of great intelligence and cold-bloodedness. It moves swiftly when continuously exposed to sunlight.

Name: Servine
Description: It runs almost sliding on surfaces. It confuses the enemy with swift movements, then strikes with its whip.

Name: Serperior
Description: It is at its best against those who are not intimidated by its noble gaze.

Name: Tepig
Description: It shoots fireballs from its nose while deftly dodging enemy attacks. It eats berries it has toasted itself.

Name: Pignite
Description: The more it eats, the more the flames burning in its stomach are revitalized, increasing its power.

Name: Emboar
Description: It ignites the punches on its fiery beard and then launches fire attacks against enemies. It has great consideration for its peers.

Name: Oshawott
Description: It not only uses the shell on its stomach during battle but also to cut berries in half.

Name: Dewott
Description: It learned through intense training the art of handling its two shells like blades.

Name: Samurott
Description: It can unsheathe its swords, strike the enemy, and sheathe them back in its forelegs in the blink of an eye.

Name: Patrat
Description: It stores food in its cheeks and keeps watch for days at a time. It uses its tail to signal its companions.

Name: Watchog
Description: It makes the enemy shudder by causing its eyes and fur to glow thanks to a fluorescent substance contained in its body.

Name: Lillipup
Description: Brave and cautious at the same time. It gathers information about the surrounding environment through the soft fur covering its snout.

Name: Herdier
Description: It is very intelligent and becomes attached easily. According to some theories, it was the first Pokémon to become a human companion.

Name: Stoutland
Description: It appears to enjoy living with humans. Specimens captured in the wild become attached within three days.

Name: Purrloin
Description: It steals things from people just to see them in trouble. Nickit is its rival.

Name: Liepard
Description: A Pokémon with magnificent fur and elegant lines, behind which hides a capricious and fierce character.

Name: Pansage
Description: It distributes leaves over its head to tired Pokémon, relieving their exhaustion.

Name: Simisage
Description: It attacks the enemy by striking it with its sharp tail. It has an impetuous nature.

Name: Pansear
Description: It is very intelligent and has a habit of roasting berries before eating them. It loves to help humans.

Name: Simisear
Description: By feeding the flame inside its body, it unleashes fire from its head or tail, scorching its enemies.

Name: Panpour
Description: The water stored inside its tuft is rich in nutrients, and it uses it to water plants with its tail.

Name: Simipour
Description: It shoots high-pressure water from its tail, with enough power to even destroy concrete walls.

Name: Munna
Description: It appears near pillows in the middle of the night. When it eats dreams, the patterns on its body faintly glow.

Name: Musharna
Description: It's best not to approach when it emits dark-colored smoke because nightmares come to life.

Name: Pidove
Description: It appears wherever people live. Be careful when feeding them, as hundreds of them may gather.

Name: Tranquill
Description: It is quite fast in flight. No matter how far it goes, it can always find its nest and its Trainer.

Name: Unfezant
Description: It excels in flight. The female is particularly resilient, but the male outperforms her in speed.

Name: Blitzle
Description: It appears when the sky is filled with lightning and thunder. It stores electricity in its mane by attracting lightning bolts.

Name: Zebstrika
Description: It has a hot-blooded nature. When it's angry, its mane releases lightning in all directions.

Name: Roggenrola
Description: It is almost as hard as steel, but it seems to soften a bit if it stays in water for a long time.

Name: Boldore
Description: When its orange crystals begin to glow, be careful as it's a sign that the Pokémon is about to release energy.

Name: Gigalith
Description: It is very resilient, and that's why it sometimes works together with humans and Copperajahs in construction and mining.

Name: Woobat
Description: If you look into a cave and see heart-shaped marks on the walls, it's a sign that Woobats live there.

Name: Swoobat
Description: After emitting powerful sound waves, it becomes so tired that it cannot fly for a while.

Name: Drilbur
Description: It joins its claws together and spins around at high speed before launching itself at its prey.

Name: Excadrill
Description: It is said that natural-looking caves are actually the result of Excadrill's frenzied digging.

Name: Audino
Description: It has excellent hearing, allowing it to even hear the sound of a stone rolling 2 km away.

Name: Timburr
Description: It likes to help with construction work, and when rain interrupts them, it vents its frustration by spinning its beam.

Name: Gurdurr
Description: It shows off its muscles by competing with others of its kind and with Machoke. The losers disappear from circulation for a while.

Name: Conkeldurr
Description: Concrete prepared by Conkeldurr is much harder and more resilient than average, even though its composition is no different.

Name: Tympole
Description: Tympole sings underwater with its high-pitched voice, creating delicate ripples on the surface.

Name: Palpitoad
Description: It weakens its prey with sound waves that cause headaches and then captures it with its sticky tongue.

Name: Seismitoad
Description: It causes tremors with every step, vibrating the ground like a seismic quake. It is related to Croagunk as a species.

Name: Throh
Description: It is very skilled in throwing techniques. The sweat it produces during battle soaks into its karate belt, causing it to darken.

Name: Sawk
Description: It constantly strives to become stronger. If you encounter it in the mountains while training, it's best to quietly sneak away.

Name: Sewaddle
Description: It makes its own clothes by cutting leaves and sewing them together with sticky thread it produces from its mouth.

Name: Swadloon
Description: The forests it inhabits are lush thanks to the nutrients processed from the dead leaves by Swadloon.

Name: Leavanny
Description: When it encounters a young Pokémon, it makes a dress for it using leaves and the sticky silk from its mouth.

Name: Sandile
Description: It hides under the sand and moves like it's swimming. This way, it avoids enemies and maintains its body temperature.

Name: Krokorok
Description: Its eyes are covered by a very thin membrane, allowing it to see even in the middle of the night. It lives in small groups with its companions.

Name: Krookodile
Description: It captures its prey with its powerful jaws and twists its body with all its strength to tear it apart.

Name: Darumaka
Description: The flame inside its body is the source of its power. When the flame goes out, the Pokémon dies instantly.

Name: Darmanitan
Description: A hot-blooded Pokémon. The punches it throws with its huge upper arms can pulverize even a truck.

Name: Dwebble
Description: It digs a hole in a chosen stone to make it its home. It's the natural enemy of Roggenrola and Rolycoly.

Name: Crustle
Description: It prefers arid places and on rainy days, it does not leave its rock. It is very territorial.

Name: Scraggy
Description: It is very troublesome and headbutts anyone within reach, making direct eye contact very dangerous.

Name: Scrafty
Description: Even though it's careless, its kicks are strong enough to send Conkeldurr's pillars crumbling.

Name: Yamask
Description: It wanders through ruins every night. The mask it wears is said to be the face it had when it was human.

Name: Cofagrigus
Description: It is covered in a brilliant gold color. It is said that it no longer remembers being a human.

Name: Archen
Description: It was revived from a fossil. As shown by research, it is unable to fly, but it is very skilled at jumping.

Name: Archeops
Description: It takes off by running, reaching a speed of 40 km/h while covering a distance of 4 km.

Name: Zorua
Description: It surprises others by taking on their appearances. It is said to often transform into a melancholic child.

Name: Zoroark
Description: It is rumored that those who dare to try to catch it are trapped in the illusions it creates.

Name: Axew
Description: It lives in burrows it creates on the ground. In times past, it was apparently very strong, as it used to wield its tusks to cut trees.

Name: Fraxure
Description: Since its tusks break easily and don't grow back readily, it diligently sharpens them on river rocks after the end of a battle.

Name: Haxorus
Description: It dwells in caves and abandoned mines. It is peaceful, but one must be careful as it gets angry if its tusks are touched.

Name: Pawniard
Description: It fearlessly challenges even powerful enemies. If necessary, it clings to its opponent and stabs them with the blades on its body.

Name: Bisharp
Description: It commands groups of Pawniard. Groups that lose in territorial battles are absorbed by the winners.

Name: Larvesta
Description: It was called the 'larva that stole the sun.' With the flames it spews from its horns, it can cut through sheets of iron.

Name: Volcarona
Description: Those living in warmer regions hate its scorching body, but in colder lands, it is revered as the embodiment of the sun itself.

Name: Cobalion
Description: Legend has it that it fought against humans alongside Terrakion and Virizion to protect the Pokémon of Unova.

Name: Terrakion
Description: It possesses extraordinary strength. It shows no mercy to those who threaten Pokémon smaller than itself.

Name: Virizion
Description: According to legend, it fought alongside Cobalion and Terrakion until the end to protect the Pokémon of Unova.

Name: Tornadus
Description: Its lower body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It speeds through the skies at 300 km/h.

Name: Thundurus
Description: It fires off lightning bolts from the spikes on its tail. It flies around Unova, shooting lightning everywhere.

Name: Reshiram
Description: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It assists those who want to build a world of truth.

Name: Zekrom
Description: This legendary Pokémon can fill the world with lightning and thunder. It helps those who want to build an ideal world.

Name: Landorus
Description: Since the lands it visits produce abundant harvests, it is considered a blessing to the fields.

Name: Kyurem
Description: This legendary ice Pokémon awaits the hero who will restore its true form with ideals or truth.

Name: Keldeo
Description: It roams the world, moving across the surfaces of seas or rivers. It appears in the most pleasant shores.

Name: Meloetta
Description: It sings a melody that has the power to bring joy or sadness to the hearts of the Pokémon that hear it.

Name: Genesect
Description: An Ancient Bug Pokémon modified by Team Plasma, which greatly enhanced the cannon on its back.
